org.mfg.mdb.compiler

Class Column

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mfg.mdb.compiler.internal.AbstractJSON
      • org.mfg.mdb.compiler.Column
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.json.JSONString, org.mfg.mdb.compiler.internal.IJSON

    public class Column
extends org.mfg.mdb.compiler.internal.AbstractJSON
implements java.io.Serializable
    Definition of a column. Can be used by external tools like schema editors.
    Author:
    arian
    See Also:
    Table, Schema, Serialized Form

        public Column(java.lang.String name,
              Type type,
              Order order,
              boolean virtual,
              java.lang.String formula,
              int offset,
              java.util.UUID uuid)
        Creates a column.
        Parameters:
        name - The name. Use a valid Java identifier name, because this one is used as part of fields, parameters and methods names in the generated code.
        type - The type.
        order - The order (ASC or DESC).
        virtual - If the column is virtual.
        formula - The formula. It is should be a valid Java expression. TODO: Missing reference.
        offset - The byte-offset. TODO: Missing reference.
        uuid - A unique identifier.

      • getFormula

        public java.lang.String getFormula()
        The formula of the virtual column. See isVirtual(). A formula string should be a well formed java expression (r-value), used as value of the column. There are some predefined "variables" that can be used in a formula:
        • $pos$: It is the record position. It can be used to get an auto-increment field.
        • $$: It is a reference to the record. For example, if we want to store fake and real prices we use a rawPrice of type long, if the price is real, we use a positive number, else we use a negative number. Then, we define 3 columns: rawPrice, price and real, where price and real are virtual: 
           
 Formula of price:
                "java.lang.Math.abs($$.rawPrice)"
 
 Formula of real: 
                $$.rawPrice < 0
        TODO: This explanation should be moved to the main documentation and here we just put a reference.
        Returns:
        the formula
        See Also:
        isVirtual()

      • isFormulaBasedInPosition

        public boolean isFormulaBasedInPosition()
